explanations.a: Correct. Thermosets undergo irreversible chemical changes during curing and cannot be remelted.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Thermoplastics can be reheated and reshaped.
explanations.c: Partially true, but some elastomers can be reused in limited ways.

questions.question: In general, strongest polymer group is __________.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Strength varies among polymer types.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Elastomers are flexible but not the strongest.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Thermoplastics are moderately strong but not the strongest.
explanations.d: Correct. Thermosets have high cross-linking, making them mechanically strong and heat resistant.

questions.question: Elastic deformation in polymers is due to _____________.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Severing bonds causes permanent deformation, not elastic.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Straightening implies larger deformation than elastic.
explanations.c: Correct. Elastic deformation occurs due to small, reversible adjustments in molecular chains.
